Istana Kumpulkan Data soal Kasus 'Desa Hantu'
07 Nov 2019, 11:03 by Andhika Prasetia
Jakarta - Besarnya anggaran dana desa memicu munculnya ide pembuatan 'desa siluman' atau 'desa hantu'. Pihak Istana tengah mengumpulkan data-data terkait kasus ini.
"Kami di tim jubir juga sedang melakukan, mengumpulkan informasi-informasi tentang apa yang berkembang. Ada yang mengatakan dari 70.400 desa itu ada dana yang tidak sampai atau ada desa yang tidak ada. Segala macam. Kami sedang kumpulkan," ujar Stafsus Presiden Fadjroel Rachman di Kompleks Istana Kepresidenan, Jakarta Pusat, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Fadjroel mengatakan pengumpulan data dilakukan untuk memastikan apakah benar ada dana desa yang tersalurkan ke 'desa hantu'. Informasi ini nantinya akan diteruskan kepada Menteri Sekretaris Negara (Mensesneg) Pratikno.
"Nanti data itu akan kami berikan pada Pak Mensesneg untuk diberikan pada informasi atau pendapat langsung dari beliau. Kami sedang kumpulkan data karena dari pihak Menkeu (memberikan) pernyataan demikian, dari Menteri Desa (juga). Kami kumpulkan data, apakah nyata ada di lapangan," ujar Fadjroel.

Palace Collects Data on 'Ghost Village' Case
Nov 7 2019, 11:03 by Andhika Prasetia
Jakarta - The large budget of the village fund triggered the idea of making a 'stealth village' or 'ghost village'. The Palace is collecting data related to this case.
"We in the spokesman team are also doing, gathering information about what is developing. Some say that from 70,400 villages there are funds that do not arrive or there are villages that do not exist. All kinds. We are gathering," said Stafsus President Fadjroel Rachman in the Presidential Palace Complex, Central Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019).
Fadjroel said the data collection was carried out to ascertain whether village funds had actually been channeled to 'ghost villages'. This information will be forwarded to the Minister of State Secretary (Menesneg) Pratikno.
"Later we will give the data to the Minister of State Secretariat to provide information or opinions directly from him. We are currently collecting data because of the Minister of Finance (giving) such a statement, from the Minister of the Village (also). We are collecting data, is there real evidence in the field? , "said Fadjroel.
